org.jimmutable.core.serialization.writer

Class LowLevelWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jimmutable.core.serialization.writer.LowLevelWriter

  • public class LowLevelWriter
extends Object
    LowLevelWriter is a low level wrapper around Jackson's JsonGenerator. Absent something *truly unusual*, you should *never* have any need of LowLevelWriter in your code. Use ObjectWriter instead. Default error handling behavior for all low level IO function is trap all exceptions (including IOExceptions) and then throw them on as chained SerializeException(s)
    Author:
    jim.kane

        public void writeStringObject(String str)
        Write a string in its complete object encoding (i.e. not as a JavaScript Primitive, but as a full object, with type_hint, etc.)
        Parameters:

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(Object obj)
        Write an object. Primitives (Strings, Integer, Double, etc.) will be written in complete object encoding (i.e. not as a JavaScript Primitive, but as a full object, with type_hint, etc.)
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to write. Can be null.
